PIMJfCT INNOVATE
March 13, 1967
The Honorable Walter S. Baring
2434 Rayburn Office House Building
Washington, D. C.
Dear Congressman Baring:
I regret that I was unable to see you personally on my recent visit to Washington regard¬
ing the Educational Television Bill which has been introduced in the Senate. However,
Mrs. Dollard was very gracious in taking considerable time with me to discuss both the
legislation and the status of the ETV project in Nevada.
From our conversation, I know that your office will give the bill careful study. I know,
too, that you have a tremendous amount of written material to review, but the Carnegie
Commission Report will be well worth your time for a better understanding of this legis¬
lation before it reaches the House.
Should you or your staff have questions regarding the Commission Report or the Senate
Bill, please feel free to call any one of the following at the office of the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB), 1346 Connecticut Avenue N. W.,
telephone 667-6000: Mr. William G. Harley, President; Mr. C. Scott Fletcher, Execu¬
tive Consultant, or Mr. Chalmers H. Marquis, Jr., Executive Director of Educational
Television Stations, a division of the NAEB; and Mr. Jerrold Sandler, Executive Director
of National Educational Radio, also a division of the NAEB.
Please convey my thanks to Mrs. Dollard for the time she took with me. I hope to have
the opportunity to meet you personally sometime soon, and I shall look forward to re¬
ceiving your newsletters.
Sincerely
HELENA. SIDLER (Miss), Coordinator
Research and Development
